page.title: 03LODDINGTON FARM
page.content: Loddington Farm extends to over 160 acres. The owners, Mr and Mrs Smith, live in a 19th century ragstone farmhouse and are the fourth generation of their family to farm here. The top of the house affords a wonderful view across the Weald to the south coast. The farm mainly produces fruit,- apples, pears, damsons, blackcurrants, strawberries, and also mushrooms. These are sold at Covent Garden and other markets, and the strawberries and blackcurrants, picked by a force of up to 40 women, are on contract. Two fields are growing corn this year and willow wood is used to make cricket bats when 16 years old. The farm has 7 permanent men workers, and the machinery includes 4 tractors, a fork-lift truck and spraying machines.
